lines.text: Oh, that's right. What I call football, you call soccer. So, this is a soccer ball.
We don't play soccer.
It's for foreigners.
Well, I'm a foreigner.
Well, we're American.
I'm your man!
What do you have to do to believe in yourselves?
What?
We believe in them, don't we, Sheriff Tom?
Hm?
Tell the kids we believe in them.
Oh, yeah, yeah. Course we do.
Even if we do decide to go to Austin, how we gonna get there? Walk?
I got a question.
That's great! Great, participation! Fire away, big guy!
While you're here, who's giving out speeding tickets and scooping dead animals off the highway?
All right, no more questions.
I think Juan would want you to do well in school and in soccer.
He wouldn't want me to do well. He'd want me to win.
You didn't even say goodbye.
Don't be mad. I wanted to.
Well, next time you leave, say goodbye.
Next time I leave, I'll just take you with me.
I'm little, I'm low to the ground, I got power, I got moves! I'm your man!
That's how you know they're not coming back. People only say 'Goodbye' when they plan on saying 'Hello' again. It's a rule.
